Separately cultivating the counting of the breath, not fixed in emptiness, not fixed in conventionality, contemplating the Buddha-nature of the middle way before and after, this is the counting of the breath in the distinct teaching.
If one contemplates this breath as neither empty nor provisional, with the three truths of one mind being expounded perfectly, this is the counting of the breath in the perfect teaching.

It is like the three-week teaching of the Lotus Sutra, which is generally called revealing the three and manifesting the one.
